newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - Oct 21.

text.p: The following is a summary of major South Korean political stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not gaurantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.

- Prosecution to summon former Defense Minister Lee Yang-ho tomorrow to probe alleged leakage of military secrets during his tenure as chairman of joint chiefs of staff: lee's bank accounts to be scrutinized to track alleged bribe money taken from arms dealer.
- Japan's ruling liberal democratic party fails to secure majority in parliamentary election Sunday.

- N. Korean Foreign Ministry's American bureau director-general Lee to visit U.S. this week to meet with U.S. officials to discuss relations with the U.S. following last Month's sub infiltration incident.
- Past military procurement projects under close scrutiny in connection with leakage of military secrets involving former defense minister lEE.
- Prosecution to summon Lee Yang-ho to probe bribery, leak of secrets.
- King Jung Carlos I of Spain arrives here for 5-day visit.
- Former Defense chief faces questioning by prosecution: lee Yang-ho tied to bribery, military leaks.
